facts.1: Martyrs' Day in Myanmar commemorates the assassination of Aung San and six cabinet members in 1947.
facts.2: It is a day to remember the struggle for independence from British colonial rule.
facts.3: The main event takes place at the Martyrs' Mausoleum in Yangon, Myanmar.

facts.1: This day marks the victory of the Sandinista movement in Nicaragua over the Somoza dictatorship in 1979.
facts.2: It is celebrated with public parades, music, and cultural events throughout Nicaragua.
facts.3: The day is also a reminder of the end of an era of dictatorship and the start of a new chapter in Nicaraguan history.

facts.1: The Flitch Trials are an ancient English ceremony where married couples convince a jury of their undying love for a side of bacon.
facts.2: This tradition is believed to have started in the 12th century, and it is held every four years in Great Dunmow, Essex.
facts.3: Successfully \'winning\' couples are paraded through town and awarded a flitch of bacon.
